notes.text:
An update is now available for Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.4 on RHEL 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7 is a platform for Java applications based on the WildFly application runtime.

This release of Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.4.12 serves as a replacement for Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.4.11 and includes
bug fixes and enhancements. See the Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform 7.4.12 Release Notes for information about the most significant bug fixes and enhancements included in this release.

Security Fix(es):

* undertow: OutOfMemoryError due to @MultipartConfig handling (CVE-2023-3223)

* jackson-databind: Possible DoS if using JDK serialization to serialize JsonNode (CVE-2021-46877)

* jettison: Uncontrolled Recursion in JSONArray (CVE-2023-1436)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jackson Databind. This issue may allow a malicious user to cause a denial of service (2 GB transient heap usage per read) in uncommon situations involving JsonNode JDK serialization.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jackson-databind: Possible DoS if using JDK serialization to serialize JsonNode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform installation and deployed applications.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to: https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: jackson-databind: Possible DoS if using JDK serialization to serialize JsonNode

notes.text: A flaw was found in Jettison. Infinite recursion is triggered in Jettison when constructing a JSONArray from a Collection that contains a self-reference in one of its elements. This issue leads to a StackOverflowError exception being thrown.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform installation and deployed applications.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to: https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgments.organization: System and Software Security Lab in Fudan University

cwe.name: Memory Allocation with Excessive Size Value

notes.text: A flaw was found in undertow. Servlets annotated with @MultipartConfig may cause an OutOfMemoryError due to large multipart content. This may allow unauthorized users to cause remote Denial of Service (DoS) attack. If the server uses fileSizeThreshold to limit the file size, it's possible to bypass the limit by setting the file name in the request to null.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, back up your existing Red Hat JBoss Enterprise Application Platform installation and deployed applications.

For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to: https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
